Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Royalisin-D (Royalisin D, royalisin C-termnal deleted analog, synthetic AMPs, 3S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, insect defensin, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (78.43%) toRoyalisinK: 25%; R: 19%, I=L: 13%. Obtained by deleting C-terminal TSFKDLWDKRF from the parent peptide.Activity: active against S. aureus (MIC 9.5 ug/ml), S. alactolyticus (MIC 12 ug/ml), S. intermediusB (MIC 4.6 ug/ml), S. xylosus (MIC 18 ug/ml), P. larvae (MIC 10 ug/ml),  Gram- P. aeruginosa (MIC 11 ug/ml), S. cholearasuis (MIC 12 ug/ml), V. parahaemolyticus (MIC 4.6 ug/ml), and E.coli.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: interin technology. purified for antimicrobial assay, peptide yield: 1 mg/L.Replaced: the original has been replaced 12/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Bílikova K, Huang SC, Lin IP, Šimuth J, Peng CC. 2015
Literature Information.Title: Structure and antimicrobial activity relationship of royalisin, an antimicrobial peptide from royal jelly of Apis mellifera.
